availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on August 6, 1830 in Kenton County. Kenton County Attorney. Married on July 8, 1850 to Kate Hereford, nee Blackburn. They had six children. Took charge of Bourbon County school 1856. Deputy Clerk for Kenton Circuit Court 1856-1865. Commissioner for Public Schools of Kenton County in 1858. Admitted to the bar in 1862. Elected member of the Board of School Examiners for Covington in 1865. Died on July 4, 1914 in Covington.

bibl.p: Armstrong, J. M. The Biographical Encyclopedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century. Cincinnati, Ohio: J.M. Armstrong & Company, 1878. "Kentucky, Vital Record Indexes, 1911-1999," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QKCM-YZZS : 1 July 2015), A C Ellis, 14 Jul 1913; citing Death, Kenton, Kentucky, United States, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort. KYR-0001-020-1486. Wiggins, 0. J. “History of Covington.” Bulletin of the Kenton County Historical Society December 13, 1884.
